result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Spenner III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bond to be applied to costs and remaining balance to be paid as a condition of probation in 15-CM-271.

Time shall be serve with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William R Spenner III

Def in person & by Atty Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Resolution reached; State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1.  Defense free to argue on jail time; argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
15R 016218;   Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #108927 on 8/5/15

Def in person & by Atty Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Def has other pending cases (15CM477, 15CM358, 15CM271 - OWI charge will be filed in 15CM358) - counsel is hopeful of global resolution in Br 3.  Court sets $300 cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Atty Benjamin Wallis Lutgen appearing for Def, who does not appear.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def not present due to not having transportation.  Counsel req adj.  Court authorizes but stays warrant until next court date.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
